text: 200:1 The Vâ g asaneyi-sa m hitâ reads: Om, krato smara, k li be smara, k ri ta m smara. Uva t a holds that Agni, fire, who has been worshipped in youth and manhood, is here invoked in the form of mind, or that kratu is meant for sacrifice. 'Agni, remember me 'Think of the world! Remember my deeds!' K li be is explained by Mahîdhara as a dative of k li p, k li p meaning loka, world, what is made to be enjoyed (kalpyate bhogâya).
